t: Revelation 7
The Sealed of Israel
After*p this I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, restraining the four winds of the earth so that no wind could blow on the earth or on the sea or on any tree.
Then I saw another angel rising up from the east, who had the seal of the living God. He cried out in a loud voice to the four angels who were allowed to harm the earth and the sea,
“Don’t harm the earth or the sea or the trees until we seal the servants of our God on their foreheads.”
And I heard the number of the sealed: 144,000*ln sealed from every tribe of the Israelites:
12,000*ln sealed from the tribe of Judah, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Reuben, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Gad,
12,000*ln from the tribe of Asher, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Naphtali, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Manasseh,
12,000*ln from the tribe of Simeon, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Levi, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Issachar,
12,000*ln from the tribe of Zebulun, 12,000*ln from the tribe of Joseph, 12,000*ln sealed from the tribe of Benjamin.
A Multitude from the Great Tribulation

After*p this I looked, and there was a vast multitude from every nation, tribe, people, and language, which no one could number, standing before the throne and before the Lamb. They were clothed in white robes with palm branches in their hands.
And they cried out in a loud voice: Salvation*pn belongs to our God, who*ln is seated on the throne, and*ln to the Lamb!
All*p the angels stood around the throne, and along with the elders and the four living creatures they fell facedown before the throne and worshiped God,
saying, Amen!*pn Blessing and glory and wisdom and*ln thanksgiving and honor and*ln power and strength be*ln to our God forever and ever. Amen.
Then*p one of the elders asked me, “Who are these people in white robes, and where did they come from?”
I*p said to him, “Sir, you know.” Then*p he told me: These are the ones coming out of the great tribulation. They washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
For*pn this reason they are before the throne of God, and*ln they serve him day and night in his temple. The*ln one seated on the throne will shelter them:
They*ln will no longer hunger; they*ln will no longer thirst; the*ln sun will no longer strike them, nor*ln will any scorching heat.
For*ln the Lamb who is at the center of the throne will*ln shepherd them; he*ln will guide them to springs of the waters of life, and*ln God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.
